      • toTensor[T: ElemType](values: openArray[T]): Tensor[T]
        zeros
      • zeros[T: ElemType](dims: varargs[int]): Tensor[T]

The tensor module contains a simple ndimensional array type which is stored in host memory. e.g.

Example:

import nimxla/tensor
import math

var t = toTensor[float32](1..6).reshape(2, 3)
for i in 0 ..< t.dims[0]:
  t[i, 0] = sqrt(t[i, 0])
echo t

Imports

private/xla_wrapper, private/utils

Types

DataType = enum
  InvalidType, Bool, I8, I16, I32, I64, U8, U16, U32, U64, F16, F32, F64, Tuple,
  OpaqueType, C64, BF16, Token, C128
DataType lists all of the XLA data types. 
ElemType = float32 or float64 or int64 or int32 or uint8 or bool
Literal = ref LiteralObj
Literal is reference to a tensor or tuple of tensors resident in host memory in the format used by the XLA library. 
Shape = object
  case kind*: ShapeKind
  of ArrayKind:
      dtype*: DataType
      dims*: seq[int]

  of TupleKind:
      elems*: seq[Shape]
A shape is gives the data type and dimensions either for a single tensor or for a tuple of tensors which might be returned from XLA. 
ShapeKind = enum
  ArrayKind, TupleKind
Tensor[T] = object
  dims*: seq[int]
  data: TensorData[T]
A Tensor is a fixed size array where the data is laid out contiguously. Copying a tensor is a shallow copy - i.e. it is a view on the same data. 
XLAError = object of CatchableError

Procs

proc `$`(lit: Literal): string {....raises: [ValueError, IOError, OSError, XLAError],
                                 tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Convert to a tensor and pretty print the result. will convert the data type if needed to cast to a supported tensor type. 
proc `$`(s: Shape): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Pretty print shape info. Will recursively generate list of shapes for tuples. 
proc `$`[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]): string
Pretty print tensor type, shape and summary of data. 
proc `==`(s1, s2: Shape): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Have same data type and dimensions? 
proc `==`[T: ElemType](t1, t2: Tensor[T]): bool
Checks have same shape and values are equal 
proc `[]=`[T: ElemType](t: var Tensor; ix: varargs[int]; value: T)
Update the element at the position given by the array of indices similar to []. 
proc `[]`[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]; ix: varargs[int]): T
Get the element at the position given by the array of indces or empty array for a scalar. Negative indices may be used to offset from end of the dimension. Will raise an exception if index is out of range.

Check error status and rakses an XLAError exception if not nil.

Copy data to a new literal 
proc clone[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]): Tensor[T]
Return a copy of the tensor 
proc convert(lit: Literal; dtype: DataType): Literal {....raises: [XLAError],
    tags: [].}
Convert type of each element. Allocates a new literal with the result. will raise an XLAError exception if conversion fails. Just returns the orginal tensor if the data type is already matching. 
proc decomposeTuple(lit: Literal): seq[Literal] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Decompose a literal containing a tuple into a seq of literals. If input is not a tuple then returns a single element sequence. 
proc dtype(lit: Literal): DataType {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the element data type. 
proc dtypeOf(T: typedesc[ElemType]): DataType
Map from supported tensor types to XLA element type enumeration.

    tags: [].}

    tags: [].}

Create a new tensor withe the given type and dimensions and set every element to value.

Number of elements in the tensor.

proc newLiteral(dtype: DataType; dims: openArray[int]): Literal {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Allocate a new literal tensor with the given shape. 
proc newTensor[T: ElemType](dims: varargs[int]): Tensor[T]
Create a new tensor with the given type and dimnsions. Data is not initialized. 
proc rawPtr(lit: Literal): literal_t {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc rawPtr(t: Tensor): pointer
proc reshape(lit: Literal; dims: varargs[int]): Literal {....raises: [XLAError],
    tags: [].}
Returns a view of the same literal with the shape changed. Total number of elements in the tensor must be unchanged or will raise an exception. If one of the dimensions is -1 then this value is inferred from the total number of elements. 
proc reshape[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]; dims: varargs[int]): Tensor[T]
Returns a view of the same tensor with the shape changed. Number of elements in the tensor must be unchanged or will raise an exception. If one of the dimensions is -1 then this value is inferred from the total number of elements. 
proc setPrintOpts(minWidth = 8; precision = 6; floatMode = ffDefault;
                  threshold = 1000; edgeitems = 4) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Set the formatting options for printing the tensor data with the $ operator similar to numpy.set_printoptions. See the strutils package for details of the floatMode option. 
proc shape(lit: Literal): Shape {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Get the data type and dimensions for the literal. 
proc shape[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]): Shape
Get the data type and dimensions of the tensor in XLA format. 
proc toLiteral[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]): Literal
Create a new literal form the provided tensor shape and data. Will raise an XLAError exception if the copy fails. 
proc toSeq[T: ElemType](t: Tensor[T]): seq[T]
Copy the data associated with the tensor to a sequence of length t.len. 
proc toShape(s: shape_t; topLevel = true): Shape {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Unpack the raw shape_t returned by the xla wrapper. 
proc toTensor[T: ElemType](lit: Literal): Tensor[T]
Create a new tensor form the provided literal. Will raise an XLAError exception if the data type of source and destination do not match. 
proc toTensor[T: ElemType](slice: HSlice[int, int]): Tensor[T]
Create a new 1D tensor of given type with elements set to the values from iterating over the slice. 
proc toTensor[T: ElemType](value: T): Tensor[T]
Convert a scalar value of type T to a 0 dimensional tensor, 
proc toTensor[T: ElemType](values: openArray[T]): Tensor[T]
Create a new 1D tensor of given type and size by copying data from the provided array. 
proc zeros[T: ElemType](dims: varargs[int]): Tensor[T]
Create a new tensor with the given type and dimensions and elements set to zero.
